index.html
Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Preface Who This Review Is For

Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Tony Hirst Last generated on 11 September, 2021 Preface Automatically generated stage timing and results for stages on WRC EKO Acropolis Rally Greece, 2021, 2021. Based on analysis of timing and results data downloaded from the WRC website. To discuss / critique / comment on these analyses, please use the discussion forum. For a guide to the code used to generate the stage reports, see Visualising WRC Rally Results. See also Visualising WRC Rally Stages. This report is unofficial and is not associated in any way with the Fédération Internationale de l’Automobile (FIA) or WRC Promoter GmbH. Who This Review Is For The RallyDataJunkie project, such as it is, is a personal exploration of various ways of representing and visualising rally related stage, timing and results data. There are several potential audiences: rally fans, looking for summaries of rally events; teams and crews, looking for variously arranged summaries to check and compare performances; commentators and journalists, looking for variously arranged summaries and overviews as a tool for confirming or identifying storypoints; data folk, looking for various ways of representing various route, timing or results data.

driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 2.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times LOU took eighth place on stage, 14.0s behind the stage winner . GRE took ninth place on stage, 17.1s behind TÄN dropped two places to ninth overall. 2.3 Driver Report, SS2 - OGI OGI took second on stage, with a time of 796.0s and retained the overall lead of the rally, just 0.2s off TÄN. calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 5.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives EVA took eighth position on stage, 2.8s further back behind GRE and moved up one place to seventh overall. various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 7.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 8.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 9.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 10.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times
